titleStmt.title: The dismall day at the Black-Fryers, or, A deplorable elegie on the death of almost an hundred persons, who were lamentably slaine by the fall of a house in the Blacke-Fryers being all assembled there (after the manner of their deuotions) to heare a sermon on Sunday night, the 26 of October last past, An. 1623.
titleStmt.author: Rhodes, Math.

notesStmt.note: Text enclosed in mourning border with symbols of death in upper margin. Includes a partial list of victims.
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
